questions.question: If you only need to work with a subset of your data, where in your workspace should you filter it out?
options: In the reader feature type itself using a WHERE clause or directly after reading if a WHERE clause isn't available.
In the middle of your workspace after doing attribute validation.
In the middle of your workspace after doing data joins.
Directly before writing to ensure you don't write out data you don't need.

questions.question: Reader feature types that aren't connected to any other objects in your workspace are not read, therefore you don't need to worry about their performance impacts.
Which of the following tends to have the biggest negative impact on workspace performance?
Which transformer is useful for error trapping workflows?
